Subjective.History_of_Present_Illness: Chest pain started last night and has been constant for about 8 hours. The pain is sharp and located on the left side of the chest. It is worse when laying down and when taking a deep breath. It is associated with lightheadedness and difficulty breathing. The pain is rated as a 7 or 8 on a scale of 1 to 10.

Family_History.Condition: Father had a heart attack at 45 and had cholesterol problems.

Social_History.Drugs: Smokes about a pack of cigarettes a day and occasionally smokes marijuana (about 5 milligrams per week).

Exercise.Frequency: Every other day. Runs for about half an hour.

Objective.Physical_Examination: Patient appears anxious and in pain. Vital signs: Blood pressure 120/80, pulse 90, respiratory rate 20, temperature 98.6Â°F. Chest examination reveals tenderness over the left side of the chest with no signs of trauma or deformity. No abdominal tenderness or guarding. No lymphadenopathy. No rashes or skin changes.

Treatment: Blood tests (including troponin, D-dimer, and complete blood count)
Plan.Follow_Up: Patient will be admitted to the hospital for further evaluation and treatment.

Recommendations: Avoid activities that exacerbate chest pain
Follow up with primary care physician for routine check-ups and preventive care
